sub_title: Assistant Professor Health Communication in Health Care at Maastricht University
summary: My main research interest focuses on communication about health and health behaviours (such as smoking, alcohol & dietary consumption patterns) between patients & health professionals and in health care in general. I aim to improve such communication by means of psychological and organisational interventions (such a computer tailoring programmes). Additionally, I am interested in measuring and improving Informed and Shared Decision Making processes and Adherence to both lifestyle and medical regimens.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

projects.title: Exploring Sexual Behaviours among University Students in Khartoum State, Sudan
projects.description: The main objective of this project is to evaluate and study the efficacy of a web-based computer-tailored behavioural change. program to reduce HIV transmissions among University students in Khartoum state (Sudan)

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor Health Communication in Health Care at Maastricht University
Also visiting Professor at University of Seville since 2019

projects.title: Optimizing Patient Care for Complex Type 2 Diabetes Patients: The CT2D Healthy Living  eCoach
projects.description:
Most  interventions  on  improving  diabetes care  focus  on  diabetic  patients  in primary  care,  usually without complex comorbidities. In this project we will focus on the more complex type 2 diabetes (CT2D)  patients  that  are  treated  by  specialized  health  care  professionals  (HCP’s)  in  the  GP  and hospital  setting  as  these  type  of  patients  require  more  guidance  and  more  tailoring  of  their treatment. Study 1 aims to assess among CT2D patients and HCP’s how eHealth can be of added value in the process  of  current  (secondary)  care.  The  input  from  Study  1  will  be  used  to  optimize  program development of the T2D Healthy Living eCoach. Study 2 is a RCT to test the efficacy of the eCoach in comparison with usual care, in an outpatient clinic  and  GP  setting.  The  new  program  will  be  developed  in  conjunction  with  CT2D  patients  and 
HCP’s.  The  RCT  has  two  conditions:  the  new  eCoach  and  standard  care,  with  measurements  at baseline, and at follow-ups at 6 and 12 months after the baseline, and a control condition receiving usual care. The primary outcomes are 1. Diabetes lifestyle score and 2. Medication adherence.  Study 3 assesses the cost effectiveness of the T2D Healthy Living eCoach, from a societal perspective at two levels, the care giver level and the patient level.  
Study  4  determines  facilitating  and  hindering  factors  long  term  implementation  of  the  new  the eCoach  in  in  the  Maastricht  and  other  regions,  as  implementation  is  crucial  for  obtaining  health impact.

projects.title: Adherence makes perfect: Improving practice nurses' adherence to smoking cessation guidelines
projects.description: The main aim of the study is to develop and test a computer tailoring intervention aimed to improve practice nurses' rates of adherence to the STIMEDIC guideline, a recently disseminated evidence-based Dutch smoking cessation guideline for health professionals.

projects.description: The main aim of the project is to develop and test a decision aid for women who were treated for breast cancer and are now entering their aftercare trajectory.

projects.title: Development of a brief intervention for prenatal alcohol use
projects.description: The aim of this project is to develop two tailored brief intervention programs for pregnant women, which can be implemented in prenatal care and to test the effectiveness of the interventions using a randomized control trial with three conditions. The aim of both interventions is to stimulate pregnant women to stop drinking, in accordance with the advice stated by the Health Council of the Netherlands in 2005. The first intervention is based on the Health Counseling Model combined with motivational Interviewing and the second is a Computer Tailored intervention.

projects.title: Effectiveness and feasibility of a web-based multiple tailored smoking cessation programme and tailored counseling by practice nurses
projects.description: The main goal of this study was to test whether offering a web-based multiple computer-tailored programme and the additional effect of a tailored counselling protocol for practice nurses to adult smokers wanting to quit within six months (preparer or contemplator), results in a significant higher percentage of quit attempts and sustained abstinence, compared to usual care in general practice. Furthermore, practice nurses’ willingness to engage in smoking cessation counselling was assessed, as well as the feasibility of utilising the tailored counselling protocol in everyday practice.

profile_positions.description:
My main research interest focuses on communication about health and health behaviours (such as smoking, alcohol & dietary consumption patterns) between patients & health professionals and in health care in general. I aim to improve such communication by means of psychological and organisational interventions.

Additionally, I teach & develop both Bachelor and Master Health Promotion courses and supervise student internships.
